greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=1. a(n+1) = a(floor(n/a(n))) + 1.
comment: Records occur at 0,1,3,10,41,206,1237,8660,69281,623530,6235301, which appears to be A002627. See A132424 for a related sequence. - _John W. Layman_, Aug 20 2007
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000
maple: a[0]:=1: for n from 0 to 110 do a[n+1]:=1+a[floor(n/a[n])] end do: seq(a[n],n=0..110); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 19 2007
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = 1 + a[Floor[(n - 1)/a[n - 1]]]; Array[a, 105, 0] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 03 2017 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Aug 02 2007
ext: More terms from _Emeric Deutsch_ and _John W. Layman_, Aug 19 2007
